casebody.data:
PEOPLE of the State of Michigan, Plaintiff-Appellee,
v.
John Coryell KELSEY, II, Defendant-Appellant. SC: 157940
COA: 329229 Supreme Court of Michigan. June 29, 2018

Order

On order of the Chief Justice, the motion of defendant-appellant to file an application for leave to appeal in excess of the page limitation is DENIED. The defendant-appellant shall file a substitute application for leave to appeal within 35 days of the date of this order limited to no more than 70 pages. Failure to timely file the substitute application may result in the administrative dismissal of this appeal under MCR 7.317(B).
